definition: to be dispersed/to break down/to fester/to ulcerate
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: The commander was able to rally the fleeing troops.
sentences.chinese: 指揮官能夠重整其潰散的部隊。

sentences.english: Dry reclamation of sodium silicate-bonded sands is reviewed in the paper. The keys of reclamation of sodium silicate-bonded sands are collapsibility and dewaxing rate.
sentences.chinese: 水玻璃砂的幹法再生主要是解決潰散性和脫膜率問題。

sentences.english: Dry reclamation of sodium silicate-bonded sands is reviewed in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 水玻璃砂的幹法再生主要是解決潰散性和脫膜率問題。

sentences.english: At the same time, this sand has good collapsibility and low gas evolution.
sentences.chinese: 該熱硬砂具有良好的潰散性和低的發氣量。

sentences.english: The scattered groups of soldiers have been trying to link up with each other since the army's defeat.
sentences.chinese: 軍隊被擊敗後，潰散的隊伍一直在設法匯合起來。

sentences.english: The company commander rallied his defeated and dispersed troops.
sentences.chinese: 連長把他的打了敗仗的潰散部隊重新召集起來。

sentences.english: The result of the division is the formation of sperm- cells which.
sentences.chinese: 當精子形成時營養細胞逐漸潰散消失。

definition: to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
